intro: Fimbristylis annua var. leptophylla, commonly known as the slender-leaf flat sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally wet environments, such as marshes and swamps. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters. It is characterized by its slender leaves and compact inflorescences, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. This variety is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils.
